sentences.sContent: ...The company's self-driving cars have done well over a million miles across various states in the US...
...as cities across the country imitate the walkability and transit-oriented development making cities like New York and San Francisco so successful...
...The scientists concluded that lions are also likely to live in a neighboring national park across the border in Sudan...
...You have to get across what it is about a particular area that has inspired you...
...high- minority schools are unfairly treated across our country...
...Last week I came across a couple of old school friends and we spend the entire journey in the bar...
...There were about 420 million netizens across China in 2010 and the number is still increasing rapidly...
...She gets her point across and is entertaining at the same time...
...disappointment and jealousy-are fairly consistent across cultures...
There's a bank right across the street.

phrases.pCn: 全面地；包括一切地；以三等分的钱数赌同一匹马赢得前三名

trans.tranOther: from one side to the other side of sth
